NSWv3jCTsX09MNV00FHffw.text: Best restaurant in our 2 1/2 week visit to London and out of all our prior trips too.  We have returned a couple times and can't seem to get enough of their dishes.  A great selection for 3 adults and 2 kids. A bit loud but the food and service is well worth the noise after a long day of touring.

HSiIaByzsAIhQprr5x3atw.text: Don't miss. The GG serves traditional food with a little surprise. We went because we wanted a traditional Sunday roast. I had that and it was phenomenal.  It was served with seasonal veggies, Yorkshire pudding and gravy you'd  push your mother down to get. ; } Everything cooked to perfection and delicious. My husband got the roast pork, which made my scrumptious dish seem only fair.  It was served with veggies,  a fabulous apple garnish ( And I don't like fruit with meat!!), and a pork cracklin like you've never tasted before. We were so thrilled with our dinner we went back to The GG the night before we flew home to make sure we had a yummy last night in London. We both had fish and chips with beer. The fish was smoking hot and juicy, the chips also smoking hot and perfectly cooked. Local beer/ale is on tap.  Enjoyed night 2 completely. They have a full bar, great service, and a bustling restaurant filled with locals All I can advise is GO!

A64GakZ9V8-5DJgGLnuwRQ.text: This is a great place to eat. My wife found it and frankly it was one of the highlights of our trip to London. Call for a reservation. Food will amaze you as will the ambience away from the craziness of Oxford Street.  Medium priced for London. A foodies delight.

kuXMhYnvgeQ18WVxsT-Gdg.text: Went here w a group from work. Loved the food and ambience. Fun place. Would def go again!

1bHr37RVeehxCqvV-biFnQ.text: What I got is not what I expected.  I came here for dinner my first night in town.  When you arrive, you walk into a normal looking pub.  However, the food more closely resembles a fine dining experience.  Since my employer was footing the bill, I decided to splurge.  After Siri informed me that 200 grams is equivalent to 7 ounces, I decided to order the 35 day dry aged Ashbridge Farms beef fillet with the herb and spring truffle mash and classic gravy, and a side of broccoli.  I ordered the beef medium, but it was served medium rare.  That's cool.  It was still amazing.  My knife sliced through the beef like a hot knife through butter.  The mash was flavorful and the gravy was the perfect finish.  And I actually ate all of my vegetables!  My only complaint would be the small portion size for the price.  My food cost 32 pounds, and sadly, I was hungry later on that night.  However, I will surely return the next time I'm in town.

SHB3z7OAWLhsgw9YNsafJA.text: We ate here twice this week on business (for lunch).  It has a very cool, hip but warm atmosphere.  That's it strong suit.  That, and a fair number of attractive young professionals.  The food is good.  But not great.  The service is good, but not great.  But it's just a cool looking place with ok food.  I wouldn't go again with so many other options, but it was a good enough lunch.  One lunch, I had the chicken and mushroom pie -- pretty good (again, not great).  And the other time I had the cod with artichokes (again, ok).  The decor (which looks a lot like Restoration Hardware with bleached/natural woods, bronze fixtures, and neutral tones) is the highlight.

khWTKo_jl8BVfy1BWUsneQ.text: 3 of us just had dinner here and it was the best meal of our trip to London so far. Two of us both ordered the 1/2 roast chicken with wild mushroom gravy (you have a choice of 4 or 5 gravies), bacon and sage stuffing, and sour cream/chive mashed potatoes. The chicken was great all by itself - crispy skin, tender juicy meat, great flavor.  With the addition of the wild mushroom gravy, heaven!! The mashed potatoes had great flavor and texture, but the highlight may have been the stuffing. Rather than just a lump of soggy bread, these were formed into small pancakes and pan sauteed until crisp on the outside and tender in the middle.Our third diner chose the veal served with polenta, spinach, and artichokes. Beautifully presented, the veal was melt-in-your-mouth tender and full of flavor. All of the sides were equally good. We highly recommend both of these dishes.Everyone's favorite dessert was the plum and almond cake. A wonderful little almond cake topped with a plum sauce, served with some vanilla custard and a small scoop of chocolate sorbet. Again, a beautiful presentation that tasted every bit as good as it looked.I was so focused on the food that I nearly forgot to mention the excellent service, friendly staff, and attractive dining room.

glJJHukpsanxfRymVf5kYQ.text: The food is prepared to a good standard and it comes out of the kitchen reasonably fast.  Service is friendly and the premises are clean (although those seat cushions are filthy).  The Grazing Goat is a good option if you should happen to find yourself near Oxford Street/Marble Arch and you'd like to grab a bite to eat at a pub.

zW0atRZKRWXpm6bcSM39Lw.text: Hidden gem near marble arch. Great modern interior, open front to the street. Felt like I was on the continent.

svC5JrnYs3z1QnOgaOZylg.text: Love the Grazing Goat. The Concierge from our hotel sent us there for the fish and chips - no joke. It was awesome, as we're the desserts. Great pub & bar on the ground floor and an updated but charming dining room upstairs. You'll love it.

PmL_n5tB9NueafjQc-0Qvg.text: Was here on an early Saturday evening after going to the zoo (yes yes I know- am I 5? We had family from outta town visiting ok!). Heard the name rattled about at work a few times so thought I'd try given I was sort of nearby. The place was fairly quiet when we arrived, but it filled up pretty quickly. Started out just as drinks but ended up staying for dinner.. Had the chilli squid for starter and the seared beef salad as a main. Partner had the burger, friends had the fish n chips, scallops and mackerel salad. All pretty standard fare, although my friend thought the scallops were fab. Overall, it was ok...but just ok. Think if I'd stumbled upon it randomly, I might be more inclined to be more favorable, but it being called a gastopub is a bit generous I thought. It was just a nice pub to me.

H3yNhzel8KuyF4tLXxep_w.text: Had dinner at the Goat last night. Our server Nikolas was excellent. He recommended some French champagne that was reasonably priced and very smooth. The venison was as good as most filet mignon I have eaten in the USA. Reasonable prices, great food and excellent service, what more can you ask for!

hGwJBDJToccPETFPCTNJnA.text: Very pleased with my meal at the Grazing Goat. The cozy ambiance, original wood floors, and bomb shelter reminiscent bathrooms makes the restaurant feel quaint, historical and homey. My boyfriend and I ate here, we both enjoyed our food; I had the burger and he had the pie of the day. The chips were crispy and chef serves the food on wooden boards. I loved it!

QXULqPxd-Kj7-f6i0P0PXQ.text: Very nice pub a couple blocks from the tourist zone.  Food and service were very good.  We enjoyed getting traditional pub fare with some refinement.  My chicken was slightly dry and I somehow ended up with two salads.  The strawberries-and-cream and passion fruit desserts were excellent.

GibavqjPkzk0_8q05qofzg.text: Great indoor/outdoor pub. Love the service, the decor and the clean toilets. They serve cold drinks in a classic shabby chic atmosphere. What more could you want in a gastropub? Food, you say? I will update to 3 or 5 stars after eating here. Until then, all 4 stars are well earned.

WlhUjMqVj7R7clWnWp3lkg.text: Excellent food, definitely not Pub food.  Service was spot on, we ate upstairs with 3 children and everyone had an awesome time!

FlLi8nfmto4OeuD1lnuEoQ.text: Love this place! Great food, service & atmosphere.  So glad we stumbled upon The Grazing Goat while visiting London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. Chicken & leek pie with broccoli and Suffolk Chicken with mash. So delicious

-o46L6NeKD6daSO6qGHuMA.text: Good food and great atmosphere; the wait staff was also very friendly.  A general all-around good fun.

EfL_u_1QqqUaQTEN3J8mTg.text: I normally find British food  insipid but, this local Restaurant was excellent; with a Mediterranean flair. My fish was delicious and the staff was very friendly. I recommend the green asparagus as a side order.

BmhsTDzV0EYUBuGsmi8HoQ.text: The food here was lovely, truffle and parmesan fries deserve a special mention! And prices not bad either, portions were quite good and the quality was high.The service was super quick and friendly throughout and when we arrived an hour early for our reservation expecting just to have drinks on the bar they managed to fit us in at a table instead which was great for us. Nice selection of drinks, plenty of choices for food for all tastes and hidden enough out of the way to not be too busy. We only went here because it was close to the hotel where my dad was staying while here on buisness, but we would definitely recommend it and would visit again if we were in the area.

fIB122dXPGuiPtii4sDMkg.text: Great little pub/bar/hotel tucked away near Marble arch.We ate breakfast here several times and really enjoyed the choices for breakfast, for me the favourite was the Pancakes.One night while in London, we ate dinner there, as it's a kind of Gastro-Pub, the food looked fancy on the menu and we weren't let down by its appearance, the taste was great too.I'll go back when I'm next in London, great service food and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. Pork with crackling, mmmmmm!

oIONwjxQ5SL_8ZVG9dQBHw.text: Two American business men discovered this charming restaurant around the the corner from the Cumberland hotel.  Great character, service, beverages, and food. We returned the next night, and will visit many more times.

RWUJg2b9iwV1CAICVpkGiw.text: Excellent food (short rib pie), terrific service, nice ambience, and a trendy crowd.  What more could one ask?  Only downside - enjoyed myself so much I felt compelled to have a second pint...and perhaps a third before I leave!

hsgY9dNN4fTid4JYXV7M5A.text: This is one of the faux-rustic themed restaurants in the same family as The Thomas Cubitt and The Orange.  We have had good experiences at those restaurants, so we decided to try this one.  It is just a short walk from the Marble Arch tube station.We were seated in the upstairs dining room and the friendly waitress handed us the menus to peruse, already opened to the drinks page.  We ordered a glass of wine each and both opted for the beef rib Sunday Roast.  The celeriac gratin caught our attention, so we ordered this as a side to share.When my meal arrived, my first feeling was disappointment: the yorkshire pudding was very small and ended up being more crunchy shell than substance.  The yorkshire makes the Sunday roast, for me.  Having said that, the meal as a whole was fine.  The plate came with a mini pot of gravy which you could pour out yourself, thus controlling the gravy distribution.  I poured mine all over the roast potatoes, yorkshire and beef.The beef was alright.  There were two slices and the meal came with a generous pot of horseradish sauce on the side.  The roast potatoes had a crispy exterior, but not crunchy.  This was all fine, but sometimes I enjoy getting the occasional small one which is mostly crunch.  It gives some extra texture to the otherwise sameness of the roast potatoes.The vegetables were simply blanched and for that reason tasted a bit bland.  Then again, it is better to have the vegetables slightly too raw rather than cooked until there is no flavour left at all.I was full and content by the end of the meal, and that is the most important criterion for a Sunday roast lunch.  The service from the main waitress was good, but the lady whom I assume was the manager appeared to have her mind on other things. It took a while for us to get our bill and we felt a bit taken for granted.  Overall passable, but there are other Sunday roasts in London which we prefer.

6IIY7pjkfpgaBMz36fL0Iw.text: Excellent restaurant! Oysters, fish and chips, kid goat, pints ! Great ambiance as well.

xrX_QicC_e3urcYe0vPpwg.text: Been in London two days and went to this gastropub twice for dinner.  Both nights were fantastic.  The craft cocktail was well-balanced and refreshing.  The charcuterie plate was delicious, consisting of toasted hunks of bread, a spicy tomato sauce, cooked cherries, and absolutely tasty cuts of meat.  The chicken & bacon pie along with its roasted root veg was delightful.  The thick chips were cooked well.  I ate myself into a dizzyness!After all that gastronomy, I ventured to the Grazing Goat the next night, this time with a co-worker.  This time, I made sure not to get a starter since I knew the mains would be more than enough.  They had a fish special that sounded delicious -- pan roasted sea bream on a bed of sauteed kale, creamed jerusalem artichokes, and a potato and bacon croquette.  I also got the truffled mashed potatoes that were great!  I'm glad I chose the off-menu special!Both nights, I found the service to be great, and so did my co-worker the second night.  The servers were working hard to make sure I/we was/were taken care of.Overall, the Grazing Goat is a fantastic place.  Great service, great beers on tap, great craft drinks, and dynamite food options.  It's good for a small gathering of friends, and just as good for an intimate evening for two.  So get over to the Grazing Goat...you won't regret it!

NZIJBeCAOJJ1AyV7KwiwGA.text: On New Quebec Street, tucked behind some big Oxford Street hotels, lies the relatively new Grazing Goat restaurant, bar and public house.  It is a rustic cozy little place spread across 2 floors of a townhouse.  We met up with some friends for drinks that had dinner there.  They absolutely loved their dinners.  Our server was pleasant and very casual.  Our drinks were served quickly and they seemed to have all different kinds of beer and cider available.  We were well taken care of and it is too bad I went there on my last night in town as I would have liked to come for dinner.

SvcFdOKzm0R5bnuZgqlnPw.text: This is a Thomas Cubitt pub. One of the better gastropubs in London. If you are a tourist, wondering what a gastropub is, you won't go wrong eating at this place. Also, really charming location in Marylebone.

Mf4AKvSbkKG-MOLjtrmzCA.text: Time for some authentic Fish and Chips.A few blocks from our hotel, we found this wonderful English pub. The staff was helpful and courteous.The food was great. I had Fish and Chip while others in my party tried the chicken and beef entrees. We enjoyed a nice atmosphere of fellow pub goers.The prices were reasonable for Europe.Should I find myself in the  Marble Arch area of London again, I will go back to the Grazing Goat.

nEa-A7RpYm-5rD_YIhSqcA.text: Great dinner, beautiful restaurant, creative menu. They were conscientious of our children. Nice wine selection, the menu was creative and offered lots of choices.  We ordered market fish, which was said to be trout, but to these Alaskan fishermen, but it was certainly salmon.  Regardless, it was fantastic!!  The roasted peach dessert was spot on, delicate and flavorful.

_oQxkqL5-_2-rXI-6DI2lA.text: Ahh, there is nothing better than the London gastropub.  And this one is a corker. My first night in London and I couldn't have found a better option.  Warm, welcoming, great traditional menu it's some tweaky touches and one of the best espresso martinis I've had made for a very triumphant return to London. I highly recommend the calamari starter and the salmon main course.  Also try the white wine from Kent which is surprisingly good!

WKAu1Qb1lYaCrl0BLImNcg.text: We came here on our first night in London to start our trip with a good Brit pub.  The Goat was a pleasant surprise . . . it had the usual menu items we were expecting, but in an atmosphere that was updated and more pleasant than the usual, dark pub.  Everyone was super friendly and the service was just right -- attentive but not rushing us.  As for the food, we didn't stray far from the standards -- Sunday roast (AKA prime rib) and fish & chips.  Both were excellent! We didn't have room or dessert, so we'll need to save that for next time.

mAY69d6XsYiPnekOR3wTBg.text: I am a huge fan of the Orange. The atmosphere, the food, the lazy brunches in the winter, the bustling evenings,... So when BFF told me they had a sister venue in Marble Arch, I was all ears (and stomach...). It was one of those chillax Saturdays, the weather was great, we were looking for a nice terrace to rest our feet, get healthy food and a glass of wine. The placed aced all of the requirements... Unfortunately, we arrived too late for breakfast (and that's a thing that could probably be improved, as 11.30 remains quite early to stop serving breakfast on a Saturday...) so we decided to go for a salad (prawn for her, chicken for me), yummy yummy! We had a lovely Cote de Provence (in the sun, what else??) to go with it and service was as impeccable as friendly... My heart stays with the Orange, but little sister is on a very good way!

8LmnS2CpN4XhtM_nBebyMw.text: Back our 3rd time for dinner. Once again just great. The food is always so tasty and nicely presented.

_HV-cfceSGSw0A732_Ah9Q.text: From our room at the Hyatt we could see the lamps glowing in the windows in the back of this well kept building.  In the morning we read the Grazing Goat sign above the door and decided to try it for lunch after seeing 4 stars on yelp.   It was a great pick.  The dining room is paneled in a warm and inviting pine.  The staff was friendly.  The food was great and the wine selection was ample.   Perfect for a lazy afternoon.

MVTg4Dq9sbIFCyNnPFwh6Q.text: Love the atmosphere here!  On a nice quiet street too.The food was quite good, and would have been 4 stars but my chips were not as hot as I would have liked.  I got the half chicken with classic gravy on the side.  And chips.  The chicken was cooked perfectly and very nice flavor.  Classic gravy, I loved it!  Bit salty, but very rich taste.  Dessert, I got the rhubarb trifle, and it was a bit too sweet for my taste.  All in all, certainly would come back for some casual dining.

psm72mFD-QalgU1RyO45Eg.text: I am very impressed with the Grazing Goat. From the moment I walked in I was engaged by an energetic staff who all work together to engage and serve with great attention and efficiency. Soon I enjoyed a delicious meal of  spare rib pie with gravy salad and cheese cauliflower that was all cooked and served just as one would hope for.! Oh and delicious with Mortimer cider. I will be back with my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. it was delicious!
Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. Great Cider on tap

D_H-DJtjBcFICLLdTtiqtA.text: After a long flight from SF and staying at the Marriott Marble Arch, we wanted something fairly close by and pub type food.Grazing Goat Public House, 6 New Quebec St. fit the bill perfectly. Walked in at 7:30 and were warmly greeted and seated. Shared the Potted duck & boar, spiced nectarine relish, potato sourdough toast which easily was enough for two. DW had the Half Suffolk chicken, bacon & sage stuffing and I had the Grilled Old Spot pork chop, apple sauce & crackling. Both were excellent and large portions. Also had a side of Tenderstem broccoli, onions & bacon, also very good.Full but we shared Banana rum cheesecake, caramelized banana, rum raisin ice cream which proved to be as good as it sounds.A couple of beers finished off a very good meal and a nice start to our trip.

eRwaYt66Ig_YEiiJn1TiPg.text: Fish and chips and gin & tonic, and more fish and chips and gin & tonic.  I could eat fish and chips every day at the Grazing Goat.  My husband had the chicken and ham pie.  Also delicious, but I'll stick with the fish and chips.

b15XCsRaXuwUzBd3bHCfUg.text: Good food, good service and good atmosphere. The Grazing Goat wasn't too far from our hotel which was great because we got to enjoy the neighborhood and the London "air" while walking to the restaurant. The first time I came here I ordered their fish & chips. It wasn't good. Unfortunately, I didn't try another restaurant to compare but I wasn't a fan. But everything else was good. We had the Grilled Old Spot pork chop, apple sauce & crackling; 28 day dry aged Rose County Farm rib eye, and their chargrilled British burger. When I come back to London, I'll be back at The Grazing Goat. And this time will try their brunch menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. Chargrilled British beef burger w/ cheese, bacon and chunky chips.
Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. Grilled Old Spot pork chop, apple sauce & crackling 260g
Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips. Doesn't look appetizing and tastes ok. Not worth the money

W7qHLoKb7vCIF7QNC5LvrQ.text: A solid cafe in lovely neighborhood in London. I really enjoyed the squash soup.

qLB-Y8zxFqWjVLHqubbEsg.text: There is a lovely warm atmosphere as you come into this traditional English pub.  The decor is comforting and cozy and there is something very welcoming as you leave the icy cold of a winter's night in London behind.The staff were friendly and attentive.  The menu is varied and there is something there for everyone.  I was very excited and my expectations were high that this was going to be a meal to remember.  It was a good start - oysters on a bed of ice.  I am wary of oysters having suffered the effects of a bad one more than once before but these were perfect.   The main course was beautiful but too big.Overall this is a lovely place but there was something lacking which I can't put my finger on.  My friends love this place though so no doubt I will be back

vACR3sUKuWIZo2tqTs5wxQ.text: On a surprise trip to London in February, we found this amazing gem of a restaurant. We actually are here twice, because it was such an amazing experience. There wasn't anything that we didn't love, but the guinea fowl was the most amazing entree that we had out of four. And the pork belly was the best app. I am already dying for another trip across the pond and we hope to stay at the adjoining hotel in order to be even closer to the best food in town. You can not go wrong at this restaurant and the service was great, even on super busy nights! I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom

yx4DVEXl84sl37nwyb2AYg.text: A charming small pub. Nice chair, nice tables, attractive bar, and outside seating. The menu was varied and locally sourced. There are draft and bottled beers, good wines and imaginative cocktails.But iit is the atmosphere created by the professional yet friendly staff that make this place so special.

PFeLkFFWNzOj2tIUGjQQWA.text: Hidden Gem in Central London - You will struggle to find a better all rounder in this part of L-Town.Hiding away from the hustle and bustle is always a challenge when you are trawling Oxford Street, but thanks to Yelp I found this diamond! It's a pleasant warming décor, and the staff are generally very nice. I had a very late Sunday Lunch here and Breakfast the next day.First experience was very positive; we booked a table about an hour before hand and went to dump our stuff at the nearby residence. When we returned they remembered and welcomed us with a smile. Downstairs area is first come first served, and they only take reservations for upstairs - it was a Sunday, but we didn't want to take the risk so we booked.The menu is half gastro pub half brasserie, but we couldn't see past the Sunday Roast - Two Roast Beef please! We were served by the supervisor who was knowledgeable about his wines and the property and we enjoyed talking to him about the company. Part of a small group of 4 properties, they seem to have got the formula spot on!We had a bottle of Bordeaux, which was lighter than we would have hoped for, but still a nice drop. And the food came quickly, nice and pink in the middle - Yorkies had obviously been cooked some time ago as they were dry and hard, but otherwise the food was good. Coffee and Chocolate Cake to share and we were complete! I should add that the service throughout was very attentive and non obtrusive.Breakfast was fine, I had 2 eggs benny, a double espresso and freshly squeezed OJ, came to around £15.  Service was prompt, but the guy was another one of those great London waiters who can't do eye contact - I think these guys must all have very dark histories... Though it was a beautiful day and it was a very good start to another day full of adventure!

photos.caption: Photo of The Grazing Goat - London, United Kingdom. Artwork at my table

EUT_Ibl4MX5Q_io3eU0eeQ.text: I love food in this place, food is super amazing and the atmosphere just so cozy although service could be improved a bit but all on all great place.

hz_P33gLRVcJjXH7O9yGog.text: Stumbled across this place by complete accident, and am so glad we did. I have walked past the top end of this street numerous times and often thought 'oh, there are cute looking things down there' but never even bothered to cross the road and take a look. Last week I made that giant leap and found the Grazing Goat.Got there for lunch just after 12 and we were seated downstairs in the pub area. Beautiful place, oldy worldy with a touch of modernism (yes, that is the technical interior decorators term for it) and boy did that room fill up quickly.Quick tip: Book or turn up early in order to get a table!The food is a little on the pricey side for a working lunch, around £16 a main, but the quality is well worth it. Had a fantastic corn fed chicken, absolutely delicious. Really wanted to try the Pork Chop...no idea why I didn't....I'll go back.

HPfdhmW-lxrbXH-lj2CFHA.text: We were away from home Easter weekend so my daughter a friend of hers and I went to church and then came here for the Sunday roast.   Love the atmosphere of the place.  Like an upscale, but not snooty pub.  It has areal neighborhood and family feel.  I had a well prepared leg of lamb with the trimmings. Mint jelly, popover, gravy, veggies. A nice bottle of wine. Service was very friendly.  Recommended!

G2jWSrhbDVpaUWDwIVbGSw.text: Loved the drinks, the food was superb and the staff/service could not be faulted... would definitely go back...  just very surprised at how quiet it was... :-P

PIau8WnQeGirk-2RuUuhqQ.text: I loved this place!  I went there two mornings in a row for breakfast.  The omelets were wonderful (how do they dice the butternut squash into such small cubes?).  Service was friendly, and the English Breakfast tea was a great start to the morning.  I also had fresh squeezed juice (apple, carrot and ginger), which was very refreshing after an evening at the pub.

m0J8jA1ItU5qPH19ExPeXg.text: Excellent food!  We ate here on December 23, 2016.  It was an incredible night.  The restaurant is cozy and the service was great.  And the food...ahhh it was so good.  I got the beef sirloin and short rib which were just superb.  I went with my parents, two little siblings and my grandmother.  Everyone left happier than when we came in.  Very family friendly restaurant, temperature is fine, noise level is not too bad.  Overall, I highly recommend this place.  I will definitely be recommending it to anyone who will listen!

aRqoFS0Bnjg_mE_QziB12g.text: I had a terrible experience here. I picked this place after reading all the wonderful reviews here on Yelp. When I arrived shortly before 5pm the place looked decently filled but not packed. A polite waitress greeted me and took me over to a table for one. Then, suddenly, all of London descended upon this place! There was barely any standing room. My table was surrounded and I felt very uncomfortable. The guests were looking at me wondering out loud why I was eating fish and chips here. That made me feel very self conscious and more uncomfortable. I was wrapping up my meal and the waitress could not understand that I was asking to pay for my meal so I can leave as quickly as possible. Eventually everything worked out and I left. If it wasn't so crowded and stiffling and if the waitress could understand when I told her I want to pay and leave I would have given a 4 star review. The food was actually very nice.Definitely not a place for me. Definitely not coming back.

QWI2wgpQ-nxNcbpg69oQRw.text: Downstairs is a great atmosphere, loud and bustling with a cute little outdoor area - upstairs is really nice - good vibe! The food was good but pretty forgettable - delicious steak and very tasty side salad but that's about all. Fun for a night with a few friends.

8SOc8fGS7FIFgmmbsMCezQ.text: Wonderful restaurant! Just enjoyed a fantastic Sunday roast, very reasonably priced for the area and quality of food. Friendly staff and very charming ambience. I highly recommend!

sYGVuQ67kPgnKcA5KwJPEw.text: The staff here are incompetent! It took over 20 mins to get our hot drinks! People who had arrived after us had their food before we even had a drink. The manager apparently sent our drink order to the kitchen then blamed his staff for the error although they weren't much better. We asked where our drinks were twice and were told ' the bar is slammed at the moment' but not once did she actually check to see what was wrong.The food when it arrived was nice and they did give us our drinks on the house but it was a begrudged act. I will not be rushing back in there any time soon!

06mO2g5gOW1S4WwxSpbQxQ.text: The fish and chips were so delicious. A great filling portion and cooked perfectly.  I even liked the peas which were mashed. Friendly staff. Would definitely eat here again and try something else.
